member.name: T:System.Net.Security.EncryptionPolicy
member.summary: The EncryptionPolicy to use.

member.name: F:System.Net.Security.EncryptionPolicy.AllowNoEncryption
member.summary: Prefer that full encryption be used, but allow a NULL cipher (no encryption) if the server agrees.

member.name: F:System.Net.Security.EncryptionPolicy.NoEncryption
member.summary: Allow no encryption and request that a NULL cipher be used if the other endpoint can handle a NULL cipher.

member.name: F:System.Net.Security.EncryptionPolicy.RequireEncryption
member.summary: Require encryption and never allow a NULL cipher.

member.name: T:System.Net.Security.RemoteCertificateValidationCallback
member.summary: Verifies the remote Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) certificate used for authentication.
member.returns: A value that determines whether the specified certificate is accepted for authentication.
member.param: An object that contains state information for this validation.
The certificate used to authenticate the remote party.
The chain of certificate authorities associated with the remote certificate.
One or more errors associated with the remote certificate.

member.name: T:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.PolicyEnforcement
member.summary: The enumeration specifies when the should be enforced.

member.name: F:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.PolicyEnforcement.Always
member.summary: The is always enforced. Clients that don’t support extended protection will fail to authenticate.

member.name: F:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.PolicyEnforcement.Never
member.summary: The is never enforced and extended protection is disabled.

member.name: F:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.PolicyEnforcement.WhenSupported
member.summary: The is enforced only if the client and server supports extended protection.

member.name: T:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ProtectionScenario
member.summary: The enumeration specifies the protection scenario enforced by the policy.

member.name: F:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ProtectionScenario.TransportSelected
member.summary: The transport will select between a secure and standard protection scenario depending on the type of channel used. For secure protection, integrated Windows authentication is wrapped in a secure channel and has an exactly matching channel binding token with no Service Provider Name (SPN) validation. For standard protection, integrated Windows authentication is optionally wrapped in a secure channel with an optional channel binding token and SPN validation is required. So if the request comes through a secure channel, the channel binding token (CBT) is checked, otherwise the SPN is checked.

member.name: F:System.Security.Authentication.ExtendedProtection.ProtectionScenario.TrustedProxy
member.summary: Integrated Windows authentication is wrapped in a secure channel terminated by a trusted proxy and has a channel binding token with SPN validation required. This requires the presence of a CBT, but the CBT is not checked while the SPN is checked.
